approval_data.project_name: V-KYC recordings to be fetched for Audit requirements
approval_data.project_summary: Develop a portal/dashboard for V-KYC team leads to access and download V-KYC recordings for audit purposes.
project_goals: Provide easy access to V-KYC recordings for audit requirements.
Reduce dependency on IT for retrieving recordings.
approval_data.business_context: The V-KYC team currently relies on the IT data server team to provide recordings, which are stored on the LTF ‘NFS(Network File System)’ server. This manual process is time-consuming and inefficient.

requirements.description: A portal/dashboard should be created for accessing V-KYC recordings.
Access to the portal should be provided to V-KYC team leads and process managers.
All V-KYC recordings should be available on the portal.
Recordings should be searchable by LAN ID.
Recordings should be searchable by date and month.
Users should be able to upload a file (Excel or text) with a list of LAN IDs to download recordings in bulk.
The system should process the uploaded file and trigger a backend API call.
The results of the bulk download request should be displayed in a tabular format with a "Download All" option.
The table should display a maximum of 10 records per page.
A maximum of 10 records should be downloaded at a time.
The file upload should accept CSV/TXT files.
The access for the screen will be available to very limited users (only Team leaders)

functional_requirements: Search functionality by date and month.
Bulk download functionality via file upload.
Display of recording details in a tabular format.
non_functional_requirements: Performance: The portal should load quickly.
Security: Access should be restricted to authorized users.
Usability: The portal should be user-friendly.
success_criteria: The portal is accessible to authorized users.
Users can easily search and find recordings.
constraints: Recordings are stored on the LTF ‘NFS(Network File System)’ server.
File upload size limitations (up to 50 LAN IDs per file).
Bulk download limited to 10 records at a time.
assumptions: The existing infrastructure (NFS server, network) is stable and reliable.
The backend API for processing requests will be available and functional.
The necessary data is available on the NFS server.
risks: Performance issues due to large data volumes.
Data integrity issues during file processing.
Integration issues with the NFS server.

recommendations: Specify the technology stack for the portal.
Define the data retention policy for recordings.
Add non-functional requirements like performance and security.

identified_gaps: Detailed specifications for the backend API.
Specific security measures for the portal.
